deductibleMet: No (Insurance Priority listed as Active, but DED not met)
oopMax: No (Out of Pocket Max not met per Insurance Verification)

notesSummary: 12/21/25: Admitted in acute distress; initiated Detox Protocol 1 (Page 251).
12/23/25: Sent to ER for +3 bilateral edema in feet; diagnosed with peripheral edema and B-12 deficiency (Page 158).
12/29/25: Cognitive clarity improving; gait remains unsteady but 'steadier' with cane use (Page 134).
12/31/25: Patient well-groomed, cooperative, processing trauma related to childhood and custody battle (Page 319).
clinicalCycle.barriersToStepDown: Significant physical impairment (peripheral neuropathy and unsteady gait), emotional dysregulation regarding separation from children, and the need for continued monitoring of bilateral lower extremity edema (Page 313).
clinicalCycle.reasonsForStepDown: Improving cognitive status, commitment to a 30-day program, and transition from PRN anxiety meds to maintenance meds (Page 134).
clinicalCycle.remedies: Continued trauma-focused therapy, referral to a physical therapist for balance issues, and coordination with Dr. Honda (PCP) for medical follow-up (Page 323).

reviews.clinicalNotes: Detox Level 1 established with 72-hour Q30 min observation (Page 126).
Transitioned to Residential status; 1-hour safety checks maintained due to fall risk (Page 246).

diagnoses: F19.20 Other psychoactive substance dependence, uncomplicated (Nitrous Oxide)
F33.9 Major depressive disorder, recurrent, unspecified
assessment.precipitatingEvent: Excessive use of Nitrous Oxide leading to neurological deficits (inability to walk for 6 months) and a CPS investigation after a child obtained one of her nitrous tanks (Page 20).

mentalStatus.risk: History of 'fixation on hanging'; currently no active plan or intent (Page 251).

assessment.biomedicalConditions: Chronic peripheral neuropathy, unsteady gait/limp, B-12 deficiency due to inhalant abuse, and +3 bilateral pitting edema in feet (Page 127).
assessment.medications: Wellbutrin XL (300mg), Gabapentin (300mg TID), Acamprosate (333mg), Lorazepam (0.5mg PRN), and various supplements (Folic Acid, B12) (Page 135).
assessment.substanceUseHistory: Nitrous Oxide (DOC): 1-2 tanks daily for 1.5 years. Past history of Methamphetamine (teen years), Marijuana gummies, and intermittent Cocaine (Page 20-21).
assessment.treatmentHistory: 2015: Promises (Malibu) for Meth; 2023: Alta Mira (Sausalito) for Nitrous (Page 24).

psychosocialStressors.financial: High spending on substances; currently freelance writer (Page 126).
psychosocialStressors.employment: Freelance writer/PhD in Behavioral Neuro Science (Page 127).
psychosocialStressors.relationships: Separated from husband; boyfriend 'not inducive to sobriety' (Page 127).
psychosocialStressors.legal: Active custody battle and history of CPS involvement (Page 20).

assessment.moodSymptoms: Night terrors, frequent crying episodes, feelings of worthlessness, and 'humiliation' regarding relapse (Page 312).
assessment.barriersToDischarge: Ongoing physical instability, lack of a sober support network (boyfriend uses), and significant emotional instability regarding her children (Page 127).
assessment.treatmentPlanGoals: Medical stabilization and safe detox. Gain insight into the neurotoxic effects of Nitrous Oxide. Develop trauma-informed coping skills. Establish a stable aftercare environment and legal mediation (Page 63).
assessment.dischargePlan: Step down to Intensive Outpatient (IOP) with continued AA/NA attendance; Referral to a specialist in EMDR and somatic therapy for trauma processing (Page 321).

identity_profile.professional_background: PhD in Behavioral Neuroscience; Freelance Writer on Neuroplasticity
identity_profile.strengths: Highly intellectual, creative (writer/knitter), motivated to remain in treatment for 30+ days, resilient history of recovering from physical paralysis (Page 127, 312).

the_struggle.primary_conflict: Severe Nitrous Oxide dependence used as a maladaptive coping mechanism for treatment-resistant depression and anxiety (Page 20).
the_struggle.physical_toll: Peripheral neuropathy and B-12 deficiency leading to historical loss of ambulation and current unsteady gait with +3 bilateral pitting edema (Page 127, 158).
the_struggle.systemic_toll: Active separation/divorce, CPS involvement, and an ongoing custody battle for children aged 6 and 8 (Page 20, 127).

stabilization_milestones: Successful transition from acute Detox Level 1 to Residential status (Page 246).
Improvement in cognitive clarity: from brief 'yes/no' responses to engaging in deep trauma processing sessions (Page 251, 319).
Medical stabilization of bilateral edema via compression stockings and referral to PCP (Page 313).
clinical_remediation.therapeutic_focus: Processing a history of childhood trauma and emotional neglect; addressing the 'humiliation' of relapse in the context of her academic background in neuroscience (Page 312, 321).

immediate_goals: Establishment of Dual Power of Attorney with her father to manage legal/parental responsibilities (Page 134).
Consistent use of assistive devices (cane) and proper footwear to prevent falls (Page 231).
Stabilization on a medication regimen of Wellbutrin XL and Gabapentin, transitioning away from inhalant use (Page 135).
path_to_reclamation.aftercare_vision: Step down to IOP with a heavy focus on EMDR and Somatic therapy; engagement with a Sober Coach (Roland Williams) and consistent AA/NA attendance (Page 321, 327).

perspectives_reclaim.auditor_summary: Patient is a high-functioning professional whose addiction caused a catastrophic physical and social collapse. Clinical documentation reflects a high level of medical necessity due to physical fall risks and complex legal/familial stressors. Reclamation is evident in her shift from an 'unkempt' admission state to active participation in group sessions and planning for a stable, sober future for the sake of her children.
